column4: guys i have a problem with an old computer.. the bootup sequence gives me problem.. could you help me??
Try computerhope.com, is a website with lots of info and data on startup or boot options or whatever.
i have setup everything, but i have no idea why my pc keeps on forgetting about it:)
I had to replace a CMOS battery for that, but it varies with each box.
You can easily make a Boot Disk that overrides the CMOS/BIOS settings and runs the way you wish it to.
Look at bootdisk,com or look at FreeDOS.
what should i do with that?
Basically you are making a Bootable device, floppy,USB,CD or whatever, but is a bit more than basic, is more like a BeOS or BSD startup.
what could i do with it though?
Does your box have a floppy?
wait!!! antix has started booting up!!:)
http://www.bootdisk.com/readme.htm <<that explains it better than I can in this medium.
what's a liftoff?:) anywa i think everything has gone allright
Than I am a happy man and I am going fishing now!
ahhahahahah ok :) have a nice fishing:)
